page.title: 08 Knotting Green Farm (Crops)
page.content: This farm is run by the consortium of Hill Samuel and Velcourt, each sharing percentages of the profit. The farm covers 1700 acres, only a part of this falling within our region at Higham Park. The fields are widely spread and some are very large; two at Higham Park being over 35 hectares each. The main crops are wheat, barley and oil-seed rape. They do their own planting and spraying; a single tractor covering about a hectare per hour means it takes over a day to do some fields. Combine harvesters operate at the same rate but they usually have three machines working together. They have 7 tractors, 3 combines and sprayers. Grain is stored in large buildings to sell at suitable times. In 1984, fire destroyed 43.8 hectares of crops with 11.5 tons of grain per hectare.
